result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter B. Boris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter B. Boris in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Peter B. Boris in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All files heard: 15CF185, 15CF300, 15CF331, 15CF431

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF185 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF431 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Atty Halverson agrees this will be a 4th offense within 5 years of the 3rd offense. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF185 Count 1, 15CF431.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CF185 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.
15CF300 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF331 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF185 Count 1 - 
Serve 36 months prison with 24 months Initial Confinement followed by 12 months Extended Supervision - STAYED -
Eligible for Earned Release program.
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months:
Serve 180 days jail with 4 days credit, consecutive to 15CF431.
Allowed to serve the second half on electronic monitor if he qualifies for that program after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Pay $1,800 fine plus costs totaling $3,614.00.
Pay $26.45 blood draw fee. 
Revocation for 36 months. 
IID for 36 months. 
Obtain DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan. 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Agent can use DOT Assessment if agent deems appropriate.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Participate in any other counseling or assessment recommended by his agent. 
Provide a DNA sample. 

15CF431 - 
Serve 60 days jail. 
60 days credit. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Peter B. Boris in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Peter B. Boris in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF300, 15CF331 & 15CF431

3:11 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court re: 15CF300 & 15CF331. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

1:43 p.m. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Peter B. Boris appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF185, 15CF300 and 15CF331 - return on warrants.  
15GF369 (and new charge of Bail Jump).

Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2,00 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson makes statements and asks for an assessment be ordered for home monitoring and be put back on Day Report.

Warrant quashed on 15CF185, 300 and 331 and will follow newest charge.
BTC: $1,000 cash bond:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License, unless absolutely sober.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  14
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11-23-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Body only.
sent to JR 10/13/15 ks

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:59 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court.  Has warrants in other files.  Spoke to the defendant, was hospitalized previously.  Unsure of his whereabouts. 
Court reviews the file.  

BY THE COURT:  Bench warrants in each file.

Defendant Peter B. Boris NOT in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF185, 15CF300 and 15CF331.

1:22 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins requests that the warrant will continue due to the no show of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant to continue.

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Halverson makes statements.  Defendant has just been released from the hospital and the wife has provided documentation to support that.  Set for a plea/sentencing on 10/13 on the underlying charge.  Anticipates to waive the prelims in both felony charges.  Believes there is a resolution to move forward on all 3 files.  
Court adjourns this initial until 10/13. 

Asks that 15CF300 be scheduled for 10/13 as well.  That files has a warrant.
Court will not handle that matter.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
